column4: Question, I need to install Ubuntu on Dual Boot on a machine with Windows 7 and no CD drive.  The machine already has a 50gb partition that's free to use for Ubuntu.   As I couldn't figure out a way to format ext3 through windows 7 in order to install ubuntu I'm following the steps to boot with the ubuntu-10.04.1-desktop-amd64.iso and Linux Live USB Creator.  I was just about to free up a 10 gb or
I was just about to free up a 10 gb or so partition in the HDD for this purpose.  Is it going to work?  Am I missing something?  Am I doing something terribly wrong?
so you already have a 50gb partition for ubuntu to use, and you want to free up 10 more?
i don't see why it wouldn't, but you probably only need 1gb or so
